meanings.definition: To cover or hang loosely in folds
meanings.sent1: She was draping the blanket over the couch.
meanings.sent2: The curtains were draping elegantly by the window.
meanings.sent3: He tried draping the tablecloth like a superhero cape.
meanings.sent4: The vines were draping the old building like a protective shawl.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece involved draping colorful fabrics across the canvas.

meanings.definition: The way in which fabric hangs or falls
meanings.sent1: The draping of the dress accentuated her figure.
meanings.sent2: The draping of the fabric gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent3: The cat found comfort in the soft draping of the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The draping of the waterfall over the rocks was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The draping of the flag symbolized unity and pride.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging fabric in a graceful or flowing manner
meanings.sent1: Her draping of the scarf added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent2: The draping of the tablecloth at the event was impeccable.
meanings.sent3: The draping of the fabric resembled a cascading waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The draping of the vines around the archway created a magical entrance.
meanings.sent5: The designer's skillful draping of the fabric created a stunning gown.
